intro: Petrophyes purpurascens, commonly known as the red-flowered rock cress, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to rocky habitats in the western United States. It is characterized by its compact growth habit, with basal leaves that are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, showy pink to purple flowers during the spring and early summer. Its flowers are borne on slender, branching stems that rise from the base of the plant. Petrophyes purpurascens is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
